Posts.Content: David, did you use Coral calcium? Ann
Posts.Title: Alternative vs. Conventional

Posts.Content: I have had a mastectomy for invasive and non-invasive lobular cancer in-situ tumor grade 2. During the surgery a positive lymph node was found in the breast tissue. I did not have sentinel node nor axillary dissection done. I have been on a number of supplements including ellagic Acid, essiac, Indole-3, green Tea and flax seeds. It has been suggested that I take chemo. Four rounds of A-c and four rounds of Taxol. Has anyone out there just used alternative methods instead of the conventional/ I have agreed to take the Arimidex but nothing more. Any information would be appreciated. Thanks, Ann
Posts.Title: Alternative vs. Conventional

Posts.Content: Holly, thanks for your response. I am willing to try all of your suggestions. I am told that I have advanced local cancer, as a positive node was found in the breast tissue. meanwhile, I checked with the naturopath and nothing I am taking has estrogen. The tumor was 95% estrogen receptor positive. merry Christmas and a Joyous New Year. Love, Ann
Posts.Title: Alternative vs. Conventional

Posts.Content: Verna, Thanks for your information. I am awaiting the results of my Pet Scan, so we know how to proceed. Ann
Posts.Title: Alternative vs. Conventional

Posts.Content: Thanks, Marilyn. It was a good boost and confidence builder. Ann
Posts.Title: Alternative vs. Conventional

Posts.Content: Gaye, Thanks for your response. I did read your story and it was encouraging. Tuesday I have my PET scan, and I am hoping for good news. Ann
Posts.Title: Alternative vs. Conventional

Posts.Content: Robyn, Thanks for your information. I hope all is going well for you. On December 30th I had a PET scan and it turned out to be normal.There are no tumors or inflammation. I am relieved. I have decided to take the Arimidex in addition to the supplements and will look into accupuncture. I will be in touch to find out more about the nutritionalist. I have been to a Naturopath. thanks for your information. Ann
Posts.Title: Alternative vs. Conventional

Posts.Content: Wendy, Thanks for your response. I am curious as to what you used for herbs. did you get involved with T'ai chi? Any information is appreciated. Ann
Posts.Title: Alternative vs. Conventional

Posts.Content: I recently had a total mastectomy wtihout the lymph nodes being touched. During the surgery, a lymph node was found in the breast tissue, the surgeon removed it and it was found to be positive. The oncologist suggested axillary dissection, radiation, chemo and tamoxifen and arimidex. I had planned to take Arimidex and fortify this with a macrobiotic diet and supplements. Has anybody had any experience with this? When the biopsy was taken I was told I did not need chemo, now the plan has changed. Any information would be appreciated. Thank you, Ann
Posts.Title: Treatment options: Tamoxifen vs. Arimidex Combined with Alternative Methods

Posts.Content: In July, I reached my sixth year of remission from stage 3 lobular cancer. then in August, I had a bowel resection, and the pathology report came back stage 4 lobular. The doctor told me this is very rare. Does anyone have any information about this?  Thank you, Ann
Posts.Title: Stage 4 Breast Cancer found in samll intestine

Posts.Content: I am interested in hearing about users of essiac of ellagic acid for the treatment of breast cancer.
Posts.Title: Ellagic Acid and Essiac
